Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (6 ll. of deed and, at right-hand side, remains of 24 short lines with its abstract) and names of 16 witnesses on verso. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Contract respecting the rebuilding of a house and party-walls, between Taibis daughter of Petenephotes and Pelaias son of Thotortais. Scribe. Nesmin son of Phib. Date. year 16 Paophi of Ptol. Soter I = BC. 290 (Dec. 4)-289 (Jan. 3)". Nos.10522-10532 and 10535-10537 belonging to the same archive, cf. P. BM EA 10522.
Bibliographic references: Glanville 1939 / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum I: A Theban Archive of the Reign of Ptolemy I, Soter (p.xlii-iv, 19-27, pl.1, 5-6)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (43762) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/43762)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, loss Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Tabbed: glassine paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: leather Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
